definition: Fortress Besieged, 1947 novel by Qian Zhongshu 錢鐘書|钱钟书, filmed as a TV serial
to encircle/to surround/all around/to wear by wrapping around (scarf, shawl)
to besiege and strike the relief force (idiom); strategy of surrounding a unit to entice the enemy to reinforce, then striking the new troops

sentences.english: The moment I finished this book the fort that trapped me vanished.
sentences.chinese: 在本書完結的那一刻，困擾本人多年的圍城就消失了。

sentences.english: They return at evening: they make a noise like a dog, and go round about the city.
sentences.chinese: 他們晚上轉回，叫號如狗，圍城繞行。

sentences.english: About to face Shenk the Overseer and stop the siege, are you?
sentences.chinese: 你問我面對督軍山克並阻止圍城的事？

sentences.english: Zhang plays Sun Yat-Sen in the movie "Bodyguards and Assassins".
sentences.chinese: 張涵予在電影《十月圍城》中扮演孫中山。

sentences.english: In 1.16, naval leaders will also get siege pips.
sentences.chinese: 新版裏海軍將領也有圍城值。

sentences.english: Fallujah's main hospital was seized by the US troops in the first days of the siege.
sentences.chinese: 費魯傑的主要醫院在圍城的第一天就被美軍佔領了。

sentences.english: Those in the cities would not attack the tents of the besiegers.
sentences.chinese: 那些防守城市的也不會進攻圍城一方的營地。

sentences.english: The French and Vietminh settled in for a long siege.
sentences.chinese: 法國和越南的軍隊進入了一場曠日持久的圍城戰。

sentences.english: Married couples are advised to avoid arguments and confrontations in this month.
sentences.chinese: 步入婚姻圍城的情侶最好不要在本月發生拌嘴和爭執。

sentences.english: They return at evening, snarling like dogs, and prowl about the city.
sentences.chinese: 他們晚上轉回，叫號如狗，圍城繞行。

sentences.english: It is the stress of a people living in a city under siege.
sentences.chinese: 這是生活在圍城中的人們所承受的壓力。

sentences.english: On the north side of the house several poplar trees formed a small garden.
sentences.chinese: 而靠房子北邊有幾棵白楊樹圍城的一個小花園。

sentences.english: Siege in modern literature history is a unique style of satires.
sentences.chinese: 圍城是中現代文學史上一部作風共同的挖苦小說。

sentences.english: Soviet authorities were absolutely silent about this aspect of the siege.
sentences.chinese: 蘇聯當局對圍城戰的這一面隻字不提。

sentences.english: In the besieged cities the animal nature right of the public have been infringing.
sentences.chinese: 圍城內公衆的兼聽權遭遇到從未有過的侵害。

sentences.english: On the day, a real "Dead Rising" was staged in the streets.
sentences.chinese: 這天墨爾本街頭都會上演真實版的“殭屍圍城”。

definition: to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
humble abode/to live (in a tiny, cramped space)
to recount/to narrate/to give an account of
to abridge/to cut a text down to size for publication
to abridge (a text)/to edit out (of a movie)/to cut back (a budget, a curriculum)
